Reviews.Title: Excellent Photos from this little point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: R. Raymundo "NikonBob"
Reviews.Content: I've had a Nikon S510 a while back which I loved, and the Nikon S570 is even better.  I like vivid colors, and when set to "vivid", the Nikon S570 produces photos with beautiful vivid colors and excellent contrast. The wide angle lens has great edge to edge sharpness.  The Nikon S570 performs well, probably not the fastest (shutter lag and start-up time), but good nonetheless.  The only thing that it's really slow in is the wait time between shots, which seems to be an eternity. I've missed a few shots waiting for the camera to be ready for the next shot.  Otherwise, I really love this camera.  It's small and light enough to fit in you pocket, and it takes great pictures. And for it's price, it's definitely a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Very "COOL"  little camera !!
Reviews.Author: joedisney
Reviews.Content: I made this purchase for my wife for christmas .Although I bought this some time ago she just opened it for Christmas and she LOVES it!very easy to use  and the quality is great..very light very easy no problems what so ever .Her hobby is photography so she finds it very easy to use  and she knows her numbers and what to set it on so it is one nice little camera for when she dont want to lug around her bigger one. we have read reviews for this camera and we do not find anything wrong with it ..some say it is slow between shots ..  My wife does not at all find this camera slow between shots..no way  Some also say its blurry when you playback the photos.. Ours is not blurry at all and I played my photos back on my 32 inch HD TV..they come out clear as a bell. But some people DO have that problem..here is a solution that my wife says to do....DO NOT in any way ROTATE your photos from the camera..this could damage the memory chip you have so what we always do is Hook the camera up to the computer then load the shots on to that ..then you can rotate all you want..you will see the difference .I hope that helps people.Also..we have no need to use the software for it either.. we just plug the camera to the computer and take my shots off the camera that way  (just open the file) ..then I use my own photo sofware .. and Again not a problem at allThe Video is also cute on it..I wouldnt film "important things" such as one time events..but just for quick things..then its good .but thats not what my wife wants to use it for. so we dont mind it .All in all we are very very happy with this camera.Thank you

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S570 High Value for everyday use
Reviews.Author: J. Hofstetter "MOAshooter"
Reviews.Content: There are many good cameras in this category to select from, and all have Pro's and Con's that ultimately are reported in these user reviews.  These are personal opinion's, and mostely not scientific.  This review for the Nikon S570 tells you why I chose this camera over the others.Since I was looking for a camera that was portable and easy to use I chose to look at these "pocket" style cameras.  I've owned Canon, Olympus, Kodak and Nikon.  I've found that what I consider important is the ability to get to the picture taking mode quickly.  The next most important feature I look for is a menu system that is intuitive so that I can figure out how to do the things I want to do on a routine basis, like transfer pictures, delete those I don't want and perform a little in-camera editing.  Lastly, I look for a camera that has some automatic modes that make sense on daily use type cameras, like night mode, portraits and landscape modes.For the price I got this camera for on Amazon, this one is tops in speed and easy use.  It get's you to taking picturs very fast, from the time you open the box, until your a pro with it and just need to capture a quick shot.  No matter the situation, from family gatherings to landscapes, or low light shots to skinging movies, this camera rises to the challenge.I recommend spending the extra money for a large SD card to go along with the 12 MP capability and movie action.  If your going to keep it handy, It's worth the extra expense to get a slim case. (something that is easy to open)  Finally, even though this camera is not a professional type instrument, I've attached it to a tripod and have taken some photos over a wide exposure range to process as high dynamic range images.  This camera worked pretty good for this function. (I consider this a little more advanced function for this type of camera, but the situation called for a small portable unit like this one.)Get one for yourself and buy one as a gift.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: TEXAS12 "TEXAS12"
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before buying this camera, and I am quite pleased. I am a pro photographer who uses the Nikon SLR system, and was looking for a point and shoot. Although I am a loyal Nikon shooter, I realize that Nikon has not been the leader in the point and shoot market. However, this model has a great feel to it, sturdy and solid. It is small enough to take anywhere, and makes amazing photos,I love it. I think that a lot of the negative hype about this camera is from people who do not read the user's manual, and who do not have any skills in the area of photography. In my experience with this camera, it performs exactly as I expect it to- because I read the manual! Trust me, it's an awesome little camera.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: The camera is small and very easy to use. There are 17 different sene settings quick to get to. The CD ROM that came with the camera gives you lots of options to play with your pictures. There's 5 different color options on the camera including sepia (my sisters favorite). I think the quality of the pictures are great. When you first take the pics, it's hard to see the clarity, but after they're on the computer they look great. My mom has an $800 camera and wants this one for mother's day. Great for the price. Love this camera!! Only issue, a dead battery takes up to 100 minutes to charge.

Reviews.Title: Happy with it So Far
Reviews.Author: Eric M. Yoshimitsu
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera due to its size (dimensions) and 5x optical zoom, and price range. We've only used this camera one day, but have discovered that even in auto mode, it works quite well. The photos generated by this camera have been crisp and clear, even subjects in motion were captured with little or no blur (digital zooming revealed some blurring). This is my first Nikon, so I haven't been comfortable with the navigating the menu; however, when working in auto the camera seemed to perform well enough for a Point and Shoot experience.The video performance has been the most impressive feature thus far. The image quality has been outstanding - motion is clean and not jerky and images are crisp not pixelated.I took this camera to my niece's birthday party and put the camera in my pocket while I chased my daughter on, over, and through inflated jumper, slides, and obstacle courses and didn't feel like I had a brick in my pants. In fact there were a few times, I had forgotten I even had a camera with me. Gotta love the small compact size.This one is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: bz
Reviews.Content: I am looking for a camera for less than $200.  I am looking for either a Canon SD1200 or a Nikon S640. No body sells the S640. So, I pick the S570 instead. My main reason for the SD1200 is the Optical Stabilizer.  Main reason for the S570 is the f2.7 lens. I finally pick the S570 instead of the SD1200.The S570 is the size of a deck of cards. It is very small. So, it is difficult to hold steady. The buttons are well placed and easy to use though. There are 4 options: Auto, Scene, Smile, and Movie. There is no option to adjust the shutter speed or anything whatsoever. I can only set the maximum ISO to either "80-400" or "80-800". That is the only option. If I need a longer shutter speed, I need to pick maybe one of the night scene instead.  The S570 doesn't have optical stabilizer either. So, I am not expecting any steady shot. It does have 4-way VR. It increases shutter speed and the ISO automatically.The S570 has a bigger lens (f2.7). So, it rarely fires the flash. Most of the time, it opens wide the lens (f2.7) and let the 4-way VR kick in to compensate the lighting and movement. The color may be a little grainy but the picture is a little bit sharper. You can turn off 4-way VR. If it is off, it doesn't increase the ISO. So, the picture will be fuzzy if thing is moving.I try the Smile option. It looks for faces in the picture. After it focuses on the faces, it takes the picture automatically. I don't have to press the button. This is pretty cool. However, it doesn't work all the time. People need to have a big smile like a pug before the camera can see you smiling.The S570 has a wide angle lens. So, everything looks far far away even the guy is close. So, I need to either zoom in or stand closer... in your face kinda closer. This is so strange standing so close to the guy to take the picture.My S570 comes with a standard Sandisk 2 gig SD card and a small case. Start up time is very fast but shot to shot is kinda slow because of the size of the picture. I set the S570 to the highest quality (12M with 1/4 compression). It takes 2 to 3 seconds to save the picture to the SD card (about 5meg). If I set the S570 to lower quality, it saves the picture much faster. The S570 also doesn't get a good focus all the time. I always need to try couple time before the S570 can focus indoor or outdoor.The case that comes with my camera doesn't use a clip or zipper to close the flap. The flap use a pretty strong magnet. Many reviews say they have lens error or whatever. I guess this is what happens. The magnet may damage the camera. So, I take out the magnet first thing. Hope this help.The camera is cheap and nothing special. I give the S570 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the hype
Reviews.Author: Cowboy Jeff
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, I take pictures of my kids primarily. I was looking for a point and shoot that takes good still pictures for vacations. I was tired of hauling my heavy Nikon D50 and associated accessories everywhere. Well, after one 4 day trip of average to useless pictures, I am sending it back. I am in disbelief that all of these reviews are so favorable for this product.1. The picture quality is NOT GOOD: It takes ok outdoor pictures, but they lack depth. Indoors - the flash is useless. It will either add no light, or wash out the light colors and the subject's faces, even in portrait mode.2. S-L-O-W: If you don't mind waiting 5 full seconds between pictures, this camera might be for you. I used a class 4 memory card and it still takes 5 seconds to write to the card and focus again.3. Battery life is average at best and you cannot charge the battery in the camera.4. Actually something positive: the menu and buttons are really easy to use, the LCD is nice. The power button is finicky though and too small.5. BEWARE turning it off too quickly: I ruined at least 10% of my pictures by turning the camera off too quickly after taking a picture. It will write the picture to the card but will overlay the colors causing it too look like an old film shot that got double exposed.In short, I highly advise not buying this camera unless you are going to take still shots outdoors in good light and don't care about actually seeing the eyes of your subjects.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: William Alisauskas
Reviews.Content: i just love the camera.  The pic quality is fantastic.  the only problem i have found is it really needs a screen protector or else u are forever cleaning the view finder.  Other than that, i really cannot find one thing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: Compact Digital for Daily Use
Reviews.Author: AT
Reviews.Content: This was purchased to replace an ageing and now malfunctioning Casio Exlim EX-S600(extremely thin camera).  Overall, the S570 is a good little compact camera: picture quality is ok and there are a plethora of functions (so many that most have not yet been used).  Two most useful functions to date are the "quick retouch" and "D-lighting" functions, both of which adjust the image so you retain both the original and the retouched image in the memory card, allowing both photos to be uploaded to your PC.  Processing is a little slower than expected as the S570 does need some time to save the image before allowing the next shot to be taken (partially linked to choice of high quality images).  Also, a bit slow to start-up but appears to result from the fact that S570 is the budget version of the S640 which has "super fast startup" which the S570 lacks.  The S570 is bulkier than the EX-S600 which it replaced but lighter, possibly due to lack of the optical image stabilization available in the S640.  Battery life appears less than the camera it replaced and the battery level display is not particularly helpful as it does not show battery life until the battery is low or completely out. For a little camera to carry around daily, the S570 serves its purpose.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Robbie R
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  The picture quality is absolutely amazing.  I upgraded from a 5MP camera, so this was a great purchase.  It shows skin flaws and even clothing fibers.  I highly recommend this one.  Like a previous reviewer wrote, I wish it came with a case. I bought the light blue Nikon case to put it in.

Reviews.Title: Photos Require Too Much "PHOTOSHOPPING"
Reviews.Author: C. Rodgers
Reviews.Content: This camera looks cool but, it takes too long to focus between shots.There is a 3 to 5 second pause between each picture that is taken.  Once a picture is taken, it initially  appears out of focus...requiring you to view the pic in playback mode to see it in focus.  So you can't tell if you need to retake the picture until several seconds later.These 'few seconds' add up and can prove to be quite time consuming and annoying, especially for the people who are in the picture and are instructed to hold their poses like frozen snowmen until you can confirm that the shot was good or not.  In the meantime, bright, wide, happy smiling faces are reduced to impatient grins as they wait for you and your camera to 'get your act together'.  So capturing true "Kodak Moments" is almost impossible with this camera.Also, the camera has to re-focus the picture during playback mode so you have to wait 2- 3 seconds to view each photo.  Reluctantly, I plan to return this camera and am dreading having to start my research on a new model all over again.Then once the photos were downloaded to my computer I was amazed at how many "adjustments" needed to be done for color corrections, sharpness, color contrasts, lighting and etc.  Practically none of the photos were okay "AS IS"... they all required some tweaking.  That's too much work to get a simple photo.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Laura B. True
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer.  I like having a point and shoot so I don't miss those little moments when I am not lugging my D300, flash and accessories.  The S570 offers 3200 ISO, wide angle, macro and many other settings that make this a versatile camera that can travel with me anywhere.  Someone that is looking for great features at a low price can not go wrong with this Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Sandeep Verma "Discerning buyer"
Reviews.Content: Nikon has really excelled with this small camera.  I have had two occasions to take some pictures at some social events.  A lot of people later told me that they were really happy with their pictures.  The earlier model of Coolpix that we had suffered from a bad design for the bettery compartment - I am happy to see that Nikon has changed that design.It is really easy to use and compact.  All in all, we love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s570
Reviews.Author: E. Charles "liz617"
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like is the delay in taking the pic to saving the pic to being able to take the next pic quickly. I have small children and sometimes it's hard to capture the perfect moment so I need a camera that is ready to take the next picture quickly.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S570 -- A Great Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix S570 on May 5, 2010. I read the worst reviews first then the very best reviews. I hesitated about purchasing this model because of the few bad reviews but I decided to go with the Nikon because the five-star reviews were more convincing and furthermore the camera had all the features I wanted at the right price. My first digital camera was a Canon Sureshot and I was so satistied with it that I wanted a another Canon. I have to admit that my the only problem with the Canon was the rechargeable batteries do not work! So having learned my lesson I realized I needed a digital camera with its own ion-rechargeable battery and charger. I have been reviewing the digital cameras for over a year now, and the Canons were just always out of my budget. So when I saw the Nikons were on-sale I started to review the various models. I was impressed by the look of the box it came in; to me, it had quality written all over it. I was not disappointed. I read the complete manual before using my new camera. I am very pleased with this Nikon model because: 1. The manual is very user-friendly  2. The camera is compact with a large display that has large writings, and the buttons are not too small.  3. Very Easy to use. 4. It  has lots of neat features.  5. It takes great pictures.  6. It took the photo without any delays.  7. The ion-battery recharged in 30mins when the manual said it would recharge within 1hr.  8. It came with a video cable that enables me to view the videos on the TV.  9. I can download the photo to my laptop or download to a printer and print the photos.  10. The Software installed successfully. 11. The Softwares are user-friendly.  I took photos right away and downloaded without any problems. I will be taking some outdoor photos next week and I am sure I will be pleased with all the photos. It's a great digital camera and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Everyday Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Berger
Reviews.Content: I purhcased this camera to replace my Canon, which I LOVED!  I decided to go with a Nikon because of my daughter.  Canons take great pictures but the shutter speed is just too slow to capture a 15 month old baby doing cute baby things.  This nikon has most of the features that my canon had (it has all of the features I use regularly) the shutter speed is very quick and it is very easy to operate.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a quality point and shoot camera that doesn't cost a lot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera....Great Price
Reviews.Author: Michele Bellomo
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera! It is very easy to take pictures and download onto computer.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Colorado Radio
Reviews.Content: I like the camera.  Went from a large, older, bulky digital camera to this one.  Nice change!  Small, easy to use.  Had to buy a memory card since the internal memory isn't all the great, but that is expected.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but I expected more
Reviews.Author: Suraj K. Kurian
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the S570 to be the best purchase ever. I used to have an s210 that took some great pictures. The one think I loved about it was it RARELY ever took a bad picture. The s570 I thought would add on the already existing greatness of the s210. While it does take good pictures, every now and then I get shaky/blurry pictures.The biggest complain would be that for a point and shoot it does not automatically pick the best mode to take a picture in. Even when I do pick modes, it doesn't work the best. Maybe I need to get better at picking the right modes for a picture but lets just say with the amount I've tried, its not obvious exactly what mode you need t be shooting in. The image stabilization isn't very great in it. The Camera itself was a little bigger than I thought it would be, but it looks great though.The wide angle picture is great, you can capture way more with this up close than compared to other cameras (my reference was a Cannon sd1200. Although, I had to take the picture twice to get a good shot. The battery life is very good. I had it last about 2 days with frequent use. the 5 x zoom and the extra MP are definitely a bonus for the price. Maybe my expectations were just too high. I wasn't very thrilled with it.

Reviews.Title: Look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: Linda F. Long "linda"
Reviews.Content: This is my first product review ever. I had to warn people to stay clear of this camera.  I am an advanced amateur, using a Nikon D50 for hobby and family shots.  I have actually won some awards and a magazine cover with my Nikon so I love it and was loyal to the brand.  My son bought me this S570 for Christmas.  Two days later he returned it for me.I wanted a small camera to stick in my purse, my large SLR being inconveinent to lug around constantly.  I know I can't expect the same quality as my D50, but out of the approximately 2 dozen photos I shot inside, I will keep probably 4.  The quality of these photos,(I tried several settings) was worse than I got from disposable film cameras. They were just not sharp, the closer up photos were washed out, the wide angle just would not focus for me and the flash wouldn't come on in a large room lit with florescent lights, resulting in a grainy, unfocused photo. Maybe I could have played around with the settings a bit more, but I just feel for the 200 he payed I could get a camera that would be a literal point and shoot.I did some research and decided to try the Panasonic DMC-ZS3 that is a good price on Amazon at $240.  If anyone cares, I'll review that when it comes.  Save your money on this S570.

Reviews.Title: I shouldn't have switched from canon 1200 to nikon 570
Reviews.Author: imm "iman"
Reviews.Content: I switched from a Canon 1200 to this Nikon 570 because my Canon was dropped by my 3 year old (numerous times), and the Nikon D90 I bought just is too big/bulky to take quick shots. The Nikon 570 looks great, but these are the problems I found (I have three kids under three, so perhaps unique to me?):1 - the start up time to take a picture from turning it on to taking a photo takes way too long - I miss a lot of shots as a result. On the Canon, it was much quicker start up time - didn't realize how important that is.2 - When I want to "view" my pictures, the lens is extended - why is that? in the canon, i could review my photos without having the lens extended out of the case.3 - Switching from camera to video mode is a pain. On the Canon it is right next to the shutter button. On the Nikon, you have to go through the menu, then switch to video. Given how many quick short pics and videos I take, not having the video to camera switch  more easily accessible would make a huge difference.Perhaps I am missing something, but wish I had stayed with the small Canon 1200/780 etc series models rather than switching.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jazzy "jasmine5"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my son. He loves it! It would be nice though if it was packaged along with a camera bag to keep all parts together.

Reviews.Title: Not Recommended!
Reviews.Author: S. Nimmons "army wife"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for Christmas in 2009 and now only 4 months later it already stopped working!  I took a trip to San Antonio and when I turned on my camera to take pictures the image on the screen froze and I could not turn the camera off.  I mailed it into Nikon for a repair since it has a one year warranty and I got an email saying it would cost me $107 to fix it!!!  That's almost the same amount I paid for the camera.  Thank goodness Amazon keeps a record of your online purchases so I can fax in a copy of my order proving it's still under the 1 year warranty.  I still dont think it's a good sign the camera broke so quickly and I am worried about the cost of repairs once my warranty runs out.I also havent really been impressed with the picture quality either.  A lot of my photos have come out blurry and overexposed.  I wish now I had spent a little more and gotten a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Not up to Nikon's usual standards
Reviews.Author: C. Wright
Reviews.Content: This camera got 2 stars (instead of only 1 star) because it is easy to use and has very user-friendly menus.Unfortunately the pictures it takes look like what I get with a $5 disposable camera or my daughter's $30 children's digital camera. I have used multiple Nikon cameras in the past, and currently own a Nikon DSLR. I did not expect the same quality from this camera, however I did expect the quality to be better than our 9-year-old 3mp Sony Cybershot. I was very disappointed that this was not the case.I wanted a camera that I could take with me in my purse for quick pictures when I don't have my DSLR. I usually am indoors in these situations.This camera has difficulty focusing in both incandescent, florescent and natural lighting. I used it in Auto and several other modes, and it always took a great deal of time to focus. It didn't seem to help when I manually selected a mode.Once the camera did focus and I was able to take a picture, they often ended up blurry or soft-looking. The stabilization & motion detection didn't seem to make a difference.It took me a minimum of 3-4 attempts to get a picture that was in focus.Playback mode takes 2-3 seconds to bring the picture into focus; before that, it looks blurry on the screen even if it actually is in focus.The times I attempted to use Macro mode, the camera never was able to focus. Why have a macro mode if it can't be used?The camera also had difficulty with white balance in both incandescent and florescent indoor lighting situations. Some shots were okay when I manually set the white balance, but the auto was always terrible.Overall, it was a very long process to get a picture that was in focus, and the camera did not work well indoors, so it was not at all what I needed. I took approximately 50 shots in 3 different lighting situations, and none of them were worth keeping.I have used several other digital point-and-shoot cameras in this price range - Sony, Nikon, Canon, and Panasonic brands- and all of the other cameras have taken better pictures than this particular model. I will be returning this one and trying again.

Reviews.Title: nice package, poor performer
Reviews.Author: A. Payne "riot nrrd"
Reviews.Content: I often don't bother to review stuff, but out of all the gadgets I've bought over the years this one was the most disappointing and I thought I'd share my experience.I take most of my pics with an old Canon D10 SLR but I like to have a pocket camera for easy portability. after my last camera (a fuji pocket camera and my first foray out of the canon lineup) took a dive in the CO river, I bought the s570 to replace it. having read many good things about nikon coolpix cameras.The up sides to this camera have already been stated by others, wide angle, f2.7 lens, small package. The biggest problem I found is kind of dumb, but really really annoying. For me or at least on my camera the photos in the view screen NEVER look focused, even if the photo that was taken was in perfect focus. So it drove me nuts because I constantly thought the pic did not focus. Then there is the lag between photos, holy mother of god it takes FOREVER. I like to stitch together photos to make panoramas but making them with this camera takes an eternity. I had to bump the quality down to 8MP to make it almost tolerable, but what's the point of a 12MP camera if it's so slow at 12MP? My 2MP canon S110 from 2001 wasn't this slow. Lastly the autofocus was horrible, it takes forever to focus on anything. I tried taking a macro photo last night of the back of a white iphone and it could not focus on the grey text on the white surface.For mac users, iphoto and image capture both do not auto rotate photos from this camera, which is another big annoyance.In the end I listed this for sale. I'm going back to canon and I'm not looking back. I'm sure there are plenty of good nikons, but this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: dont waste your money
Reviews.Author: honey81 "yvonne"
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera when it first came out. it took great out door piotures. i never really took anything indoors. when i started taking indoor low lit pictures. the picture quality was terrible. the pictures were fuzzy, when the flash worked. on certain functions the flash will not work. then if the face softening is used you cant use the zoom. this is not a user friendly camera. i would have sent it back if i had found out all the disfunctions before the time was up. i am now buying a much cheaper polaroid camera that does all the same functions without the price and is user friendly.if you only want out door pictures buy this one. if not pass on this model its a waste of money. also if you use the zoom feature all your pictures are fuzzy not clear and in the action mode pictures are not clear and you can not use the zoom in that mode either....skip this model.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Donald A. Ball
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big camera buff, so I was just looking for something reasonably priced that was easy to use. Found it! Probably has more features than I will use, but maybe some day I'll spend a little time studying it in more detail. Meanwhile, it does the basic job in a dandy fashion.

Reviews.Title: If you're a point and shoot person, great camera, and more than you need
Reviews.Author: Groc
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to go into a lot of the detail. I'll just talk about what I like and don't about this camera.Previous to the s570, we had a coolpix 880 - 3.3 M - state of the art at the time. It was sort of a crossover between point-and-shoot and more technical photography. It was always a bit to bulky, although it was pretty standard sized for the time. After having the 880 for several years, we faced the fact that we're point and shoot people, so after a lot of research, we settled on this one.About the 570:In the description of what comes with the 570, it doesn't mention a carrying case. There is one, and quite nice at that.It is very compact, and will easily fit even into your shirt pocket.No separate lens cap like the 880, always a nuisance - a door over the lens opens and closes automatically.Controls are easy to use, a little small for clumsy hands, but thats all of the space that there is to use.Finally, a good sized viewfinder!I takes up to a 25 minute movie (avi file), and records decent sound, not the best, but decent. It is not, after all, a movie camera.It has all kind of smarts that I have yet to master. Over time, and a bit more time with the manual, I'm sure that I'll be taking advantage of more of the features.It has sound effects, such as a shutter sound. I find this feedback to be helpful.Maybe I'm not critical enough, but I think that it takes great pictures - good enough for a point-and-shoot person.I have yet to go through a battery charge, unlike the 880 where I always had a spare ready.When you order the camera, be sure to order a memory card for it. Its internal memory will hold something like 9 pics. I got an 8 gig card - not much price dif. from a 4 gig. This will hold over 2,300 pictures. That is, of course, excessive, but I estimate that a 25 min movie will use up around 2 gig, so in that light, it makes sense.I found there to be a very short latency between pressing the shutter button, and the picture. This is contrary to other reviews that I read about it.Dislikes:Errr, I actually can't think of any.I gave it 4 out of 5 stars, because I'm sure that a camera in this price range has some drawbacks. For me, it's just right.

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: D. Thomas "Rightwing Nutjob"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Coolpix S570 for use as an aerial photography camera. In other words, I hang it on a model airplane and trigger the shutter remotely. I was worried that I'd made a bad choice after seeing all the "blurred image" commentary in other reviews.I don't know what those folks are doing wrong..I've gotten nothing but crisp & clear shots despite the fact that everything I shoot is from a moving (frequently violently vibrating) platform.This little camera does everything I want of it, and it's lightweight and solidly built to boot.Two thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: Let down
Reviews.Author: Ryan A. Schweitzer
Reviews.Content: My review will be short and sweet. I have tried everything that I know of and what customer support thought would help to clear up the pictures this camera takes. Every picture has a haze to it. It is very rare that I can snap a pic on the first try. If I move at all the picture comes out blurry. Oh well, 150 dollar paperweight.

Reviews.Title: DELIGHTFULLY PLEASED and SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: B. F. Craft
Reviews.Content: We had purchased, tried, and returned several digital cameras looking for a good balance between picture quality and ease of use.  We were pleased to find that this camera blew away the others and was relatively inexpensive...about $135.  We are very satisfied with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: COOOOOLPIX!
Reviews.Author: T. Lovely "Easy does it Mom"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera after much research.  Our research paid off....this is a great camera!  There are so many features to choose from and it is easy to use.  We love the video features as well.  We gave this camera a workout over the holidays and we are extremely happy with the quality of the pictures.  We would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S570
Reviews.Author: Chief
Reviews.Content: I have taken this camara to Afghanistan and love it. It is small enough to keep in my pocket and the quality is great even out the door of a helo the picture is still great quality. At Home I work as Law enforcement and use the camara all the time in investagations. Night shots are great as long as you know the limitations of the camara.

Reviews.Title: It meets NIKONS REPUTATION for the price and quality
Reviews.Author: John Bean "beaner"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera so far. It seems to have the 2 qualities that make Nikon different than other cameras.1. It seems to have a fairly good quality glass lens. (keep in mind this is only a $129 camera)2. It has a very good logical system for taking pictures that is very easy to learn and has all its features arranged very well. Nikon has always been superior in its design of features for ease of use and only putting in logical features for taking the best pictures. Many other cameras over the years would put in features as selling points but many had little to do with taking good pictures. When I got this camera it took me about 20 minutes to find every feature without looking at any of the documents that came with it. Better yet, everything was arranged logically and easy to find. This is what sold me on Nikon 30 years ago when I bought my first Nikon SLR. Mind you, this is an inexpensive pocket camera but it has more features than I expected.For those that give it a low rating for picture quality I suggest that they spend some time reading the user manual. Practice using the 17 preset scenes by pressing the green scene button. Also, small pocket cameras are more sensitive to steady in low light or zoomed. If you are in low light or zoomed in you might want to use a mono-pod or rest against something firm. Better yet, change the setting. If your camera was defective when you got it or soon after this is not the place to take out your frustration. Send it back and get a working one before you write your review, it's guaranteed. Reviews are for working items.I give it high marks for a pocket camera in its price range. I especially like the wide angle and the zooming range. 28MM-140MM gives you a lot of range.

Reviews.Title: Awful Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Burke "JennyB1124"
Reviews.Content: I like to think I am a decent picture taker.  I have had many digital cameras but none as bad as this one.  It is cute and I love the pink color but I have yet to take a decent picture.  I have tried indoor, outdoor, closeups, distant landscape pictures, everything.  And every single picture comes out blurry.  I have tried every setting possible, nothing works.  I'm extremely disappointed in this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos - Very Poor Build Quality
Reviews.Author: C. Swanson "c_swanson"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in February 2010 for my wife to use during her trip to Europe this spring. The camera takes great photos and is easy to use. However, it seems to be very cheaply built. The top of the on/off button fell off during the trip. You can still turn it on and off, but only not easily. Also, the cover for the battery/memory card compartment sticks, so you have to use something to pry it open. There is also a grinding noise from inside the camera when it is turned on. It's going back to Nikon this week (6/7//10) for repairs or replacement. Good price on the camera so it has served its purpose, however being a Nikon SLR user since the 1960s I expected better from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Handy camera
Reviews.Author: C. Hubbard
Reviews.Content: I have had many Nikon cameras over the years. I like this small, lightweight camera for portability. I have had it only a limited time and no great camera trips yet but for family, graduations, home use, etc. It seems to work very well. It is faster for indoor work than my previous digital camera (L-12). The biggest advantage however is the bright screen and one in which you can control the brightness. It is easily viewed on a sunny day whereas my previous camera screen was impossible to see on a bright day. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: skeptical, but pleasantly suprised
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon coolpix S52 for almost 2 years. It was the perfect camera for me, very simple to use with great quality photos. That is until it had a lens problem and quit working. They stopped making that particular model so I had no choice but to start looking to purchase a new one. I knew I wanted another Nikon Coolpix since my first one was great. I use it to take macro pics of flowers for greeting cards that I make. After much research and hands on with the help of some very knowledgable salespersons I was pursuaded to purchase this camera. I have been very pleasantly suprised, not to mention all the many settings you get for your money.  As you can see in the examples I have posted it takes absolutely fabulous pics and is very easy to use. I love it. I have no professional training, I just learn as I go. If I can do it, you can too. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Kourtney J. Stone
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I needed something more portable than my Canon. I use it mostly to take photos in the classroom (I'm an art teacher), but I found it's so easily carried and used, that I usually keep it in my purse for anything. The indoor setting isn't very good, but I haven't had an issue with anything else camera-wise. If you're a Mac user, don't bother installing the Nikon software. It's difficult to install/use, so I just use image capture, and that works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Math teacher "Jane"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I had been looking for one for awhile and read good reviews about this one. The reviews  were right. It's a nice little camera, easy to use and takes great pictures. I would recommend it to anyone looking for something small and easy.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Long
Reviews.Content: AWESOME!!  I really enjoy this camera.  The picture quality is beautiful.  The price is great too.  I was looking for a great camera that would fit into my purse - and this was it.  I've owned Coolpix cameras before and this one blew me away.  Small, light weight, easy to use and great pics.  Need a nice small camera? I suggest you get this one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...
Reviews.Author: David Honeycutt
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and long battery life.  Clear, crisp pictures and ready to go as soon as it was charged up.  No complaints!  We are very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Favorite birthday gift
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Miller
Reviews.Content: I got the CoolPix S570 for my wife as a first digital camera for her 50th birthday after looking at a number of others. I selected it based on the control layout, size, optical zoom capability and price. She uses it constantly and is gradually learning to use the wide range of features. Her photos are impressive!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix s570
Reviews.Author: Kerry M. Robinson
Reviews.Content: Really like camera it is easy to use and takes great pictures.  I would highly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Cheap piece of junk
Reviews.Author: mathmama
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Nikon Coolpix.  I should have known better.  My first Nikon (S220) served me well till my daughter dropped it from a low height, and the lens was knocked so that it would not close.  Camera would no longer work.  I replaced it with this model (S570).  Wish I had done my homework better.  Nice looking sleek model, light, easy to carry.  Not too hard to use, but not easy to get GOOD pictures.  The main problem is that, for no apparent reason, while the camera was in its case in a side pocket of shorts, the LCD screen broke and "bled".  Now the camera is unusable, though it functions, because I can't view anything on the LCD screen.Sent it back to Nikon for repair (had it only 1.5 months).  OF COURSE, this repair is NOT under warranty, so they want to charge me $87 to repair, plus tax and S/H.  This means I can pay $104 to repair my $139 camera.  I don't think so.  Now I see other reviews where people had similar problems.These cameras break too easily.  Invest in something more sturdy and reliable.

Reviews.Title: Ok but wish I had bought a Sony
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This isn't a bad camera. I replaced my old Sony DSW50 with this new Nikon. I was thrilled with reading the capabilities of this camera but alas it has let me down.1. Red Eye - I have a 17-month-old that I am photographing (usually in action) but he will squint or blink the minute the flash comes on. So, I either get squinty shots or red-eye. If I use the red-eye reducing feature, I get NO shots with his eyes open and forget about retouching - not an option unless you have computer software.2. Ease of Use. I can't quickly switch from mode to mode with this camera. You have to use the menu to go from photo to video and whatnot. That does not make it easy to capture a little one!3. The picture quality is not all that great. I love Nikon and have used an film SLR in the past and it was fabulous. With digital, I prefer Sony. Sony cameras take better pictures.4. Another point about picture quality...if you want to use the highest quality available on the camera, it takes too long to save and I miss another photo op. Not good. So, I have to accept lesser quality photos to get more of them.5. Lastly, battery life is not all that long. It isn't terribly short, but when you are say using this for a holiday, I wouldn't probably get all the pictures I would want on a single charge.Overall, this is a good camera. I am not trying to slam on Nikon. I do like this camera minus the points above. For my next purchase (replacement), I will be going back to Sony. I strayed from Sony because my last camera went on the fritz with the mode control (maybe it was a known issue) but the pictures and simplicity of use were far superior to this Nikon.  If you aren't trying to capture things super quick, this camera will perform for you (just don't get it if you are trying to capture small children!).

Reviews.Title: Not what I was expecting.
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera, I was expecting it to take flawless pictures (hello, it's a Nikon!!). If I used the flash, it would wash out the photos. If I didn't use the flash, it was very blurry. Then to top it all off, the door to the batteries, broke. I never even dropped the camera. So, I resorted to taping the door closed, then the camera just stopped working. What a waste of money!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: le7
Reviews.Content: great camera! only weird thing is, is that sometimes the battery will die in the camera even though I didn't use the camera. overall if you want a cheap camera that works, this is a good buy!

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Taj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this camera.  It takes very good pictures.  I was a little worried about the rechargeable battery pack but that has been working very well.  This is a good family camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery not too good
Reviews.Author: Hibernia
Reviews.Content: Everything on this camera seems fine except the battery lasts for about a day and that's it.  I also don't like the fact that I can't use the camera while the battery recharges.  That's pretty inconvenient.  I guess I'm going to have to buy another backup battery :(

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: GBW "GBW"
Reviews.Content: this camera looks like brand new. it comes with a 1 year warrenty and costs half of a brand new one. camera is excellent. great pictures and features. you can't beat the deal. customer service is very good also. they answered my questions within a few hours

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Ali T "SC girl"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month now and have really enjoyed it.  While I can't say I've taken it on a big trip or anything, I have been impressed with it so far.  I was a little hesitant after reading some of the reviews about this camera, but it had strong ratings on Consumer Reports and the majority of reviews on here were positive. My last 2 digital cameras were Kodak Easy Shares but I have always heard good things about Nikons. I really like the size of this camera and the construction - it feels very sturdy. For a small camera, it has a ton of features, so I would definitely recommend reading the book before you start taking pictures so you know about all of the different settings.  I've left mine on the default settings for the most part, and have been pleased with the results in my pictures. The pictures have great color and are very clear.One thing I have noticed (and it says it in the book) is that once you take the picture, the image that immediately appears on the screen is low resolution, so doesn't always appear super clear. When you go to review mode, it is noticeably clearer, and even better when you view them on your computer or TV. You are also able to get a good idea of the quality when you zoom in while in review mode.So, so far so good with this Nikon - can't wait to take it on a trip and really test it out!

Reviews.Title: It's really just junk. Stay away!
Reviews.Author: Michael S Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I am on my second camera and just looking for the way to get it fixed or returned.The first wouldn't work - kept getting errors and so I returned (Amazon was really great about that). Second camera doesn't work after 8 months of use. The camera also suffers from poor autofocus with auto f-stop so had to fix the f-stopNow the lense won't open and the camera is generally cranky.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: justmyopinion
Reviews.Content: This camera was just what I wanted.  Easy to use and compact.  For the price it can't be beat.  Picture quality is good.  I have used it outside and inside with no problems.  There are 2 things I did not think about before purchase getting a larger Sandisk card  (a must have) and if you like taking pictures close up the lense is a wide angle so the macro setting doesn't quite get in as far.  However, the second can be adjusted with photo editing.  Overall great camera great price.

Reviews.Title: A super great little point-n-click
Reviews.Author: C. M. Connery "cocogal"
Reviews.Content: I was replacing an older digital camera that was pretty bulky for an upcoming trip. I wanted something pretty thin and light weight to take to get a bunch of fun images from our travels. What I didn't realize was that this little camera takes truly GREAT shots, and it's capture of colour is impressive. It has a lot of great settings to select from, it's super basic easy controls were simple to learn. Upon returning from our trip, we had over 600 images that were all just amazing shots. I couldn't have asked for a better little point-n-click camera. My daughter who's 6yrs old even takes great photos with it!!

Reviews.Title: S570 not a step forward
Reviews.Author: S. B. Snyder "ScottieDogFLA"
Reviews.Content: Taking Office Depot up on their recent "Trade-In and Trade-Up" promotion, I traded in my almost 2 year old 8 mp Nikon L18.  The former camera had the distinction of taking good photographs but not ever being recognized by my computer using the input cord; I would have to transfer pics by swapping the memory card in another brand of camera I owned (I also own a Nikon D40 SLR and this is not a problem so I don't believe that this is a problem unique to the Nikon brand).Anyways, in regards to the S570, this is a very nicely packaged and very small (and light) sophisticated point-and-shoot digital camera.  Like many of the new slim generation of digitals, this camera requires you to charge up it's lithium battery to get the camera to operate.  Charging time is excessively long taking several hours.Strangely, the LCD viewing area is 2.7" which might be the new standard but is smaller than the 3" area of the L series Nikon has discontinued.Picture quality is not a visible improvement over either of my 8 mp cameras and certainly not as good as the 6 mp (but larger sensor area) D40.  Facial recognition is hit-or-miss, that is, sometimes it works and others not at all.Most disappointing, however is the fact that this camera was only able to transfer photographs the very first time it was attached (via cord) to my computer.  Subsequent attempts did not succeed and I was forced to transfer the memory card to another camera (just like the previous Nikon L18!).  Apparently, the connection at the camera has been a problem for other owners of this model.I am no longer impressed with the Nikon line of small pocket digital cameras and will most likely exchange the 5570 for a Sony, Kodak or Canon model.

Reviews.Title: A litle disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Kimberli1004
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I have another nikon that I love! I loved the size and convenience. It takes really nice and clear pictures but still lacked on some areas. I hate the zoom and the digital zoom is terrible! After I got it, I read a few reviews that said they hated the camera because of the lens problems and I no more read that and used my camera for the second time and got a lens error. Not once but twice in the second time I used the camera. Sadly I wouldn't recconmend this to anyone. Nice price for a 12 megapixel but I think they cut corners on the rest of the quality.

Reviews.Title: Low quality, worse service
Reviews.Author: bannfan
Reviews.Content: Had this camera less than two months when the top button broke in half (the one used to zoom).  Sent in camera and button for repair.  The service department took a picture of the "missing" button and said it was proof of abuse.  Tried to call multiple times and the serivce department reps were rather rude.  When I asked for a supervisor, I was told the person who sent me the e-mail declining service was in charge of all operations in California and there was no one else to call... no matter how many times I asked.  The cost to ship the camera in and get repaired was quoted at upwards of 82% of the original price.  Would never recommend these products based on service experience alone!

Reviews.Title: Good, compact point and shoot digital camera
Reviews.Author: Starbuck's Fan
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality pocket camera to carry with you wherever you go.  I am impressed with the image quality, small size and user-friendly nature.  If you need a faster shutter speed and more professional shots you should select a Digital SLR with interchangeable lenses for much more money.  If you want portability and good vacation/grandkids images, I recommend this camera.Once again Amazon.com exceeded my expectations.  I ordered the camera, a small, hard-sided carrying case and two SD chips.  All of the items came from different places and all of them were in my mail within three days of ordering with regular shipping.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: L. Beane
Reviews.Content: Have only had the camera for a couple of weeks now so I'm still learning about all it's features.. but have to say it is way better than the Kodak I had before I got this one. I like the long life of the battery and that it can be recharged easily. Also like the different scene settings that allow for all the different photo situations. It's simple and easy to use. Only thing I don't like is that the pressure it takes to take a shot usually moves the camera and I end up with a fuzzy pic.

Reviews.Title: I've always used Nikons but this camera is very disappointing!
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I carry a camera with me everywhere I go - Usually my D40x or D300 but I like to have a small point and shoot that I can leave in my purse, so when I don't feel like lugging around my SLRs or messing with settings for a particular shot of my friends, I can whip out my Point and Shoot and take a quick picture. I had a Nikon Coolpix S210 for the longest time before it finally broke on me so I decided to go for a bit of an upgrade.I wish I hadn't. Although my old coolpix only had 8.1mp it had MUCH better quality than the s570 and it's 12mp. All of my pictures are blurry or grainy unless I'm taking them in the bright outdoors. The flash sucks and the delay between pictures is ridiculous! If your getting this camera to take pictures of your kids or pets or stupid things your friends do, DON'T! Those moments are instantaneous and you need to find a quicker camera to keep up with moments like that! I don't really know what's up with the screen either - whether your picture is in focus or not it ALWAYS shows up blurry on the screen.The one thing I am relatively happy with is it's video-taking ability. One of the other reasons why I like to have a point and shoot with me is for that reason and this one does a decent job at that. I took this to my friends wedding this weekend and got tons of good video of the night. Only 3 decent pictures though. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for your buck.
Reviews.Author: David Chandler "David C."
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after extensive research on Nikon, Kodak, Canon, Sony, and other name brand cameras.  I just wanted a nice simple-featured camera that would take great pictures.  I know Nikon was a good name, but seeing is believing.  This camera takes amazing pictures, especially with the vibration reduction.  No more fuzzy pictures.  The LCD screen is very vibrant and easy to see, even in the sun.  From a featured stand-point, some of the stuff, I don't know exactly what they change but for the price, it's very feature-rich.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: James M. Casey "Jim"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  Easy to use with very good quality photos and feature rich software.  Definitely a good value puchase.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S570 is a good little camera!
Reviews.Author: Girl007 "Me"
Reviews.Content: After using my little nephew's Nikon S570, I've become attached.  In my opinion, it's a great camera. It's easy to use and I've been getting really sharp pictures that pop out.  Right now I am comparing it to the Panasonic Lumix FH20, which is also a good camera but the Nikon pictures are coming out better.  I have been taking pics of the same items with both cameras and downloading them to my computer.  So far, the Nikon is winning in picture quality, surprisingly.  I do like the Panasonic, but think prefer the Nikon. I am going to play around with the Panasonic some more.  Tomorrow I will be taking both cameras outdoors and will do a comparison.  I do recommend the Nikon S570.  If you go to [...] and compare it to the Nikon S3000 (a newer model), the S570 comes out the winner.  However, I hear the S3000 is also a good model.  I never thought I'd be praising Nikon P&S; models.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JeriA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 18 year old daughter. When she pulled it out of the box she had it snapping pics within 5 mins. Very easy to use and the pictures looked fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Little Camera
Reviews.Author: E. J. Orsak
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small digital camera that was easy to use, had great features, and a reasonable price.  Found the perfect camera when I ordered the Nikon Coolpix S570 12MP Camera from Amazon.  The vibration reduction, 2.7 Inch LCD, and video features are a plus. In addition, the close up shots of my flowers in the garden are fantastic.  I love it, my husband loves it, and the photos of our grandchildren are priceless.  It's one of the best gifts I've ever given myself.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Warfield "Helicopter Bob"
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything I wanted it to do for the size, specs and price. If you are looking for more than a point & shoot, you would be pushing the envelope, so look for a higher spect camera and be prepaired to spend more money. I was looking for a small go everywhere camera to get those just in case pictures. I used to cary a Minox all the time but this is quite the upgrade. Thank you for those that were part of this type of camera design.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: bn94539
Reviews.Content: The s570 is a very good camera, its sturdy, stylish, portable, easy to use, and it has a very reasonable price tag. The only problem is that if your trying to take many pictures quickly it wont always work to well for that, it cant take many pictures quickly at one time.But overall this camera is very good, i would defiantly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Vern Ash
Reviews.Content: This camera works great, and is easy to use. I carry it with me everywhere. The picture quality is extremely good, nice clear pics, even when enlarged. I really like this easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this item just before a trip and can say that it is fantastic.  It is very easy to use and point and click is not an overstatement.  I have had a few cameras and this did a great job in low light.  You may not get some of the bells and whistles but there is enough to keep you busy.  I would say more but the short answer is it is great and gets the job done, glad I bought it and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tim A. Sereno "board gamer"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, takes great quality pictures, small, long battery life, and has the image stabilization technology which prevents blurred pictures.

Reviews.Title: Out of this world....
Reviews.Author: T. Owens
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd camera by Nikon and I am more in love with the product more than ever..the pictures are awesome the quality great and east to use functions and it was delivered a day early..I was excited to get it early and begin using it. This was my first purchase of electronics from AMAZON and I must say the service was GREAT. Keep up the GREAT work.

Reviews.Title: Excellent small digital camera
Reviews.Author: C. David "CDavid"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it has everything I was looking for. The big screen in the back makes it easy to take and view pictures and is of good quality. All the features I need are all there and easy to access. The pictures it takes are amazing.It also take nice videos and I like the fact that you can take a video for as long as you have memory. My old camera limited videos to 30 seconds and I hated that, more than often the action would happen when I was running out of time. Not an issue with this camera. And the video quality is very good.Overall a VERY good purchase for me, especially on black friday :)...

Reviews.Title: Wonderful point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Girl with the curls
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift last year, and I have to say this has served me well on my overseas travels.  The picture quality is great, and its so small it easily can fit in your front pocket, so you don't have to carry something really bulky around.

Reviews.Title: The Coolpix S570
Reviews.Author: Fitz R. Wharwood "F. R. Wharwood"
Reviews.Content: Let me begin. I am totally pleased with my S570 since I made my purchase after browsing most of the models at Amazon. After going through the manual I checked all the features on the camera. It proved itself. No one should buy this camera and use it on Auto; there are so many features for very good photography. You want a point-and-shoot, then buy a cheaper unit. I praise Nikon for specifically giving this camera a metal body. One more thing,thanks to Amazon for the price ,it is worth more.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I have ever had the displeasure of owning
Reviews.Author: Abigail M. Underhill "amu"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christmas present and it just confirmed my reasons for not buying something like this before I read reviews and compared to similar cameras. Overall the style and ease of use are fabulous but the picture quality is absolutely horrible. In the past I have had Canon point and shoot cameras that were AA battery operated but I wanted one that had a rechargeable battery because the flash reset on the Canons was very slow. I chose the Nikon because it had the 5x zoom and a rechargeable battery. The only Canons that I could find with the rechargeable battery in my price range had 3x zoom and I had always had ones with 6x so I didn't want to give up that option. I chose the Nikon. I have never ever taken so many blurry pictures in my lifetime. I am by no means a professional photographer but I have taken lots of pictures and the quality with the Canon's was far better than the Nikon. Also after taking a picture the review mode takes forever and there is no way to adjust the length of time to review the picture which my Canon allows me to do. So basically I went from slow flash reset to slow picture review and I am still missing some good shots. So I put it in a drawer and bought a Canon Power Shot SD780 IS and it is a far superior camera. The zoom is only 3x but for picture quality and overall camera quality I can give up some zoom.

Reviews.Title: SUPER TRAVELING COMPANION
Reviews.Author: ROTTENLUCKWILLIE
Reviews.Content: Enjoy its size, features, and ease of use.  Seems very well made and is just the ticket for either long trips or short hops--makes it easy to always have a camera with you.

Reviews.Title: Super choice!
Reviews.Author: ShoeShe
Reviews.Content: I absoulutely love this camera!  I wanted something that was easy to use with nice zoom capability, and this really fit my needs.  I have it in red, and it is very stylish in appearance.  I own one of the older Coolpix models, so I knew it would be a reliable camera. It is also compatible with my personal Canon Selphy photo printer.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara L. Burrows "Crafty  barb"
Reviews.Content: wanted a camera I could use to take pics from a distance and this is it.  Also it is small enough to fit in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Michael M. Arbor
Reviews.Content: I am extremely satisfied with this little camera.  It takes crystal clear pictures and is compact enough to keep in my pocket.

It's a camera, not a video camera. Thing is, technology has come a long way, if you promote something, it better work. And if someone is moving while it tries to take a picture. Good luck. It'll look like you tried to take a picture of the flash on an old camera. Very blurry.Let's look at the charger now shall we. Reviews.Author: Third World Man
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Nikon S570 as a refurbished unit. I was skeptical of the reliability, but I decided to proceed and try it out. Photos were good. Camera worked fine for about 3 months. I went to take a photo one day and received the fatal 'lens error' message. When I turned on the camera, it made faint clicking sounds and extended the lens halfway.  I tried all the recommended fixes (gently tapping the front, compressed air to blow out around the lens). It started working again intermittently over the next 2 months, then failed completely. It will not even extend the lens at all now.It was beyond the warranty period when the first problems began, or else I would have returned it. Nikon cameras are known for this problem, more so than the other makes (Canon, Olympus, Panasonic). $85.00 thrown away. Grrrrrr!I would not recommend this product. Buy a Canon Powershot. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: Low price... low performance...  short life
Reviews.Author: rodger m kanis
Reviews.Content: This camera lasted me maybe two years.  I was careful with it, so it didn't suffer catastrophic drops, kept it clean and dry, etc.  Regardless, the lens mechanism started to seize up, getting stuck on power up/power down, not going all the way back in.  I didn't receive the dreaded "lens error" message on the display, but the end result was still the same.  It is now scrap/spare parts.Like other reviewers I had more blurry pictures with this camera than any other point and shoot I had.  The camera it replaced, and older Canon s400, was superior in all respects (build quality but HEAVY, clearer consistent pictures, longevity, etc.), and lasted at least six years or more (can't recall... it was that long) before it's infamous "CF CARD ERROR" message disabled it.  I had a hunch I should have stuck with the Canon line of small PowerShot point and shoot cameras, but thought this one looked good at a cheaper price.  I was wrong.My fiance also had this camera, or the model below it/preceding it, and her's lasted less than two years as well.  Sad... as I expected more from Nikon.I will now buy a replacement from Canon to go along with our new digital dSLR camera, a Canon Rebel 3Ti.  Nikon lost me on my first try with them.

Reviews.Title: For the price, it's good enough
Reviews.Author: L. Fischer
Reviews.Content: To address some of the issues other reviewers have had:If your saving to the memory card is slow, get a better class memory card. The class of the memory card impacts how quickly it will save, and bargain bin memory cards aren't going to work as well as better ones. On my first set of test shots, only one picture took the dreaded 5-6 seconds to save, and it was way over-exposed with flash.The LCD screen on it is a joke. It LOOKS like all your pictures are blurry because the LCD is so terrible- but once I got them onto a computer, I'd say about 90% were actually usable. Unfortunately the bad LCD makes it impossible to tell ahead of time which are good and which aren't, but memory cards are cheap. Take lots of shots and delete the bad ones. The LCD by itself was worth knocking a whole star off the rating.To also address the focusing issue: If a little red dot pops up, that means the auto focus has failed. If a little green dot pops up, then it thinks the auto focus was successful. Change the zoom or change your angle on what you're photographing to get it to re-focus. Also, it wants to focus on the closest thing it detects- so if, say, there's a giant plant between you and the person you want to photograph it'll preferentially choose to photograph the plant. Lots of cheap point and shoots I've used have that problem. Look for the green square as well. If it's focusing on someone's foot, for example, if their face is far enough away it will be blurry. Move your composition until the green square finds their face. You can always crop the photo later in an editing program.I can't speak to how long it will last- I've only been testing it out for a couple of hours, about 100 shots. But it's 200% better than my last point and shoot, which is all I really needed.I think the last thing to say is that I've never seen such a thick manual for a tiny point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Slow and fragile camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew Won
Reviews.Content: Though the quality of these pictures certainly live up to a 12MP camera, this camera is very slow to take pictures. Sometimes you have to wait up to 20 seconds for the camera to finish processing a picture before taking another one. Another problem I have consistently had with Nikon Coolpix cameras is that they break very, very easily. Previously, I owned a Nikon Coolpix 7MP which suffered a light fall and the lens misaligned, resulting in a permanent "Lens Error." The repair costs would have surpassed the cost of buying a new camera. I then purchased this Nikon Coolpix 12MP, which who would have guessed -- broke because of the exact same issue. I dropped this camera and received another permanent Lens Error. It is just my bad luck that these Nikon cameras break conveniently after my 1-year warranty expires. I have permanently switched from ever buying Nikon products. I am very happy with my new Samsung PL200 14MP camera, that only takes about 2 seconds to process a photo before allowing me to take another picture. Maybe I am just a clumsy person, but Nikon was too slow and fragile for my liking.

Reviews.Title: NikonS570
Reviews.Author: dannybob65
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. The picture quality is good and the camera is durable.The only issue(s) is that even at the "fastest setting" it is slow if you want to take one picture after another in rapid succession. And if you need to change settings between video and photo, it is a multiple step task--kind of a hassle if your in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: Did not last very long.
Reviews.Author: P. BEDNAR
Reviews.Content: I purchased my S570 in late October 2010, and was initially quite satisfied with its performance. The pictures appeared sharp, video was good, etc.  However somewhere between then and recently the focusing mechanism seems to have gotten mis-calibrated. Perhaps a bad hall-effect sensor. I am confused as to why the focus system does not stop when maximum contrast is achieved- bad design.  At any rate, now the camera simply will not focus at the long end of the zoom range. You will watch the screen, see the focus pass your intended subject, then keep on going and quit, with everything out of focus.  It will not focus at infinity, and there is no method to get it to focus at infinity.  It is maddening to watch it continually refuse to focus on even a high contrast target set up on a white board.  It is almost like the thing was designed to fail, reading all of these other comments.Of course it costs far more than the camera is worth for service.I strongly suggest avoiding this camera.

Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about a year.  To the point, it just doesn't take good pictures.  A large majority of them end up being discarded because they are blurry or, no matter where I am, what the lighting is, what setting I use (and I've tried them all), or whether the battery is fully charged or not.  I've also used more than one memory card with the same result.  And then, I have to check and make sure the ones I keep look good on the computer because the view finder doesn't display them accurately.  I have so many blurry or grainy pictures of birthday parties and other precious moments that I can't retake, it's really frustrating.  It's disappointing because that's the most important feature for a camera to fail and this one would have been a decent little camera if it hadn't.

Did not bother to take into the service as I know what to expect from manufacturers as read from reviews.  Overall, worst camera ever. Reviews.Title: how disappointing!
Reviews.Author: Hannah T "tatli"
Reviews.Content: My gift to myself...a nikon S570 ...a portable camera that would take great pics...so they said...all those Aston Kucher commercials, etc....some pics are great - outdoors....it seems that after 5pm, my pics blur badly, they lack sharpness.  I have played with the ISO setting, I have tried different settings on the pre-programed options. I have found that I need to use the snow/beach day setting in the evening hours to get a NOT- sharp pic....and I have found that when I just stick my arm out and click, I have a better chance of getting a decent photograph than if I take the time to aim, focus and shoot!And...the zoom is horrible and I think I have a steady hand....what good is a zoom that I can not utilize??  I shoot the pic at the non-zoom setting, then, in photo review, zoom in on the chosen photo and crop out what I was actually aiming for.I used this camera on a trip to Turkey and shot about 10000 pics while there. I tried many ways to fix my problem - even spoke to two photo shop workers who gave good advice, but it did not give me what I needed. I joked that I needed to take 100 pics to get one good one !So my Cool Pix are not very COOL ! I am shopping now for a Canon, which I have had success with for years prior to my CoolPix.  my regular digital is the SLR type, so maybe I am expecting too much of Nikon's S570...but for the price I paid, I feel it should have performed much better.

When you go to photography school and take the class on photographing urban legend mythical creatures they instruct you to always you the Nikon Coolpix S570 12MP Digital Camera, and there you have it...I have since sold it on Ebay (last week) and I am sorry for whoever bought it :(It is possible that I received a defective camera, but overall I would just avoid this and get a Cannon powershot, that is what my other camera is and it work amazing.

Reviews.Content: Purchased this tiny camera so I could carry it in my purse. I kept it in the case at all times and was careful with it, yet the LCD screen stopped working after a couple of months of use. No big deal, I thought. Sent it in to Nikon for warranty repairs only to be told that my LCD had "impact damage" and it would cost $106 to repair it! This camera was babied! Yet, they claim that I misused it and won't honor warranty. While they offer protectors for many of their LCD screens (an upgrade, mind you), they don't have any protector for the flimsy LCD on this one and they break really easily. So, basically, it's a $160 disposable camera. If you want a small point and shoot that you can easily carry (don't we all!), this IS NOT the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a month
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos
Reviews.Content: While it worked, the camera seemed fine.Not as robust in features as Sony's Cyber-shot cameras, for the price I was paying I thought that the deal was fine. The overall performance was just ok. Good pics, easy to navigate menu. Some glitches, but I thought that was ordinary things.After spending a month travelling and taking pictures with the camera, I stored it for about two weeks.This morning I was expecting to take some pictures with the camera, so I started charging the battery. When the battery indicator showed that was fully charged, I put the battery in, push the ON buttom, the lens came out, no picture. No access to menus / stored pics. I tried to switch the camera off, couldn't do it. Tried to get some reaction from the camera pushing for several seconds each buttom...nothing.Take the battery out, put it again. Nothing. The lens are stuck. Tried to connect to the camera via USB. The pc recognizes the camera, but can't access anything. Take the battery out / in again. Pushed the "menu" buttom, the menu started, but the screen was pink and the letters white. Tried to change to "picture" mode, but the screes is black. Lens are stuck, no way to push them to their "off" position.Final word after trying 10 hours, the lens are stuck, no access to menu. Can't do anything.So, i hope anyone who might consider buying this camera, remember that sometimes, paying more is better.

Reviews.Title: Ok for those without a good, high quality camera phone
Reviews.Author: Victor Luera "Move along....nothing to see here."
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife as the iPhone 3G did not take the best pics. This camera is slow and takes a LONG time between pics to charge the flash or process the pic. It's ridiculous when you are taking pictures at a sporting event. We definitely need an upgrade. Now with the iPhone 4 and Android phones, this camera is obsolete!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S570 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: E. Bugera
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on reading reviews online and having heard positive remarks from friends who had purchased similar cameras from Nikon.  I also have a Nikon D90 which I love but it's heavy so I wanted something I could just carry in my pocket for more casual snapshots.  While the picture quality doesn't come near my D90, it was well worth the price. The biggest complaint I have is that when you take a picture, it takes about 4-5 seconds before the camera is ready to take another shot.  However, as far as general quality and size convenience I really like this camera and felt it was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: sweet replacement
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I've had this same camera for about 3 years and being my clumsy self, let it fall of a boat during a trip to Mexico, so hurried back home to try to order the same one, and thankfully still found it! Love it, easy to use, great picture quality, and can't beat the price!

Reviews.Author: imacitems
Reviews.Content: I like the camera on the whole for its size and overall quality, but 60% of the images taken have a vertical blue line in them on the right hand side.  This seems to occur regardless of indoors or outdoors, cloudy or sunny...etc.  Disappointed by this.  Glad I only paid $150.

Reviews.Content: My daughter got this camera mostly because it is pink but the features were better than some camera we had previewed.
