We haven't developed those so it may just be a screen issue.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Dougherty
Reviews.Content: I have been taking SLR photos for over 40 years using a variety of equipment, and just purchased the Nikon S570.  I also have a Nikon D60, which yields superb photos with crisp focus and great details.  I needed a small, compact camera for travelling, and based on the D60 performance, decided to stick with Nikon.  That has turned into a frustrating experience to say the least! I took the camera to a family gathering this past weekend, and I would estimate that 20-30% of the photos are out of focus.  The camera autofocus is extremely slow, and often doesn't get it right at all.  The auto face detection and focusing feature failed regularly. If you are trying to photograph children in motion, it is hopeless with this camera.  Overall, an extreme disappointment from Nikon.

Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. I got it for my birthday last year and i am still very impressed with its performance. The zoom on the camera is excellent and it takes clear vivid pictures. I also love the color. If you need a good camera this is the one to get.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S570 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: MJR Denver "MJR"
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed with this camera.  It arrived on time, properly packaged.I am not happy with the picture quality, especially the color and auto-focus feature.  I am comparing this camera to my old Panasonic I-Palm with much less zoom.This camera does have good zoom, but I have had a very difficult time getting it to focus for close-up shots.  I had an opportunity to shoot a little bird close-up and could NOT get a properly focused picture out of this camera.  I set it on auto and then when I was not able to get a good shot, I tried adjusting it to close-up and still was not able to get a properly focused picture.My old I-Palm did not have the 5X zoom, however, it was able to focus clearly on close-up shots and for distance shots the auto-focus was flawless!  I got some great pics with it.I purchased this camera to carry with me and have ready for unexpected shots.  The size is great:  it fits in my purse and is lightweight so I can carry easily when hiking.It does advance very slowly between shots.  I am sure the 5X makes it take longer for the memory to record the shot.Regarding color - things tend to skew to yellow.  I have tried adjusting it and get some improvement, but not much.  I am comparing it again to the I-Palm and my nicer Panasonic FZ35.I chose this Nikon over the similar Panasonic model because I already had (2) Panasonic cameras (which I am very satisfied with!), and thought I should give something else a try.  I wish I had stayed with Panasonic.This camera is ok.  It is convenient to carry all the time, but I have yet to get a great photo out of it.

Reviews.Title: Quality Camera with Pizazz!!
Reviews.Author: GetSmarter
Reviews.Content: I used to think that I didn't need a digital camera because my cell phone had a camera which was convenient and always with me. However, I missed out on taking a lot of great shots on my last vacation because a cell phone camera just doesn't produce high caliber pictures. So I researched various brands of digital cameras and finally decided on the Nikon Coolpix because it had all the features for taking great pictures; most importantly, the price was very reasonable.Finally, there is what I call the "cute factor". I wanted a camera that was compact, came in a variety of cool colors, and looked "cute". The Nikon ranks high on my pizazz scale!Thank you, Nikon!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Belmar Surfer
Reviews.Content: This Nikon Coolpix camera is awesome!  I've used it already a few times in video mode and the quality is fantastic. Shooting introductory surfing video (from a distance)was SO easy and good for a beginner.  Quick shots (a feature of quick rapid action intended) still photographs was FANTASTIC!  I would buy this as a gift, everyday use and beginner camera. Initial Amazon price earlier on crushed Best Buy but rebounded just prior to purchase, but still beat BB and I only went to the store for my initial hands-on research.  Shipping was fast through our seller!  I am totally sold on the ease of use, quality and capability of this camera.  You should be too!  Taking multi-use video and stills can not be easier than on this camera!

Reviews.Content: Easy to use, good picture quality, zoom is just right and sufficient. Good camera for family use at the right price.

Reviews.Title: focus way too slow and unreliable,  uncontrollable zoom
Reviews.Author: C. Lee "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: The first dumb thing is the missing optical range finder on this piece of trash. Under outdoor light, the screen is useless, I cannot see anything on it and without an optical range finder, you'll never know your composition.The worst about this camera is that it takes forever to take a shot if at all!  As such, it is only good for still objects if it manages to find the focus and that is a big IF. It is a good thing that it has a tripod mount but only if I am doing landscape or still life. It is always hunting for the right focus as well and every shot is a missed opportunity. When it finally takes a photo, like after ten trials, it will then take an eternity to save the file onto the SD card. One could take a photo with a large format camera Ansel Adam style faster then this thing.One last nail on the coffin. The zoom motor is  completely uncontrollable. It goes to the extreme ends too rapidly and I could never get it to give me anything in between, so I ended up just walk back and fro to compose as if I have a prime lens on it. But, since I cannot focus nor can I ever take a shot before the subject disappears or bored to death, there is no point in having 12 mega pixel is there?

But for that price what do you expect!? All I know it's much cheaper in price than the Sony Cybershot but takes better quality pics.

Reviews.Content: This camera is very  easy to use and very lightweight. It takes great pictures and has lots of different settings.

Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the 'Blink Proof' feature. Every time a picture is taken fo me I blimlk. Even if they say the flash is off but really it is on, I will blink... so surely this camera has the solution?No. Apparently the blink proof feature only works when the flash is disabled. But considering I don't blink when the flash is disabled it's a uselss feature.Otherwise a good little camera, good quality images and easy to use but you will want to buy a memory card as without one the camera can only hold ten or so images.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't work.
Reviews.Author: Tracy Treville
Reviews.Content: On the first day of use the camera seemed to jam.  I had to take the battery out to turn it off to reset it.  The next time I went to use it I had a very hard time getting it to turn on.  I thought it must be a contact point with the battery and tried to troubleshoot as best as I could.  Finally got it to turn on and yes, it does take great pictures and video.  No problem with the photos, quality or clarity - as long as you can turn it on.  Yesterday it wouldn't come on no matter what I tried and I am now sending it back.  I thought about exchanging it and trying the same one again but I think I am going to go with something else this time.

Reviews.Title: Good but fragile
Reviews.Author: L. Davis
Reviews.Content: I admit, I was impressed with this camera and its price.  Unfortunately, after taking reasonable care by putting it in a protected camera case and then carefully placing it in my carry on luggage, the back screen has shattered.  Of course, the big screen was a selling point, but you may want to consider that it is very fragile and thin.  Although not 2 months old, the camera store will not take it back and states that Nikon will not replace it as it was my fault.  I can't say I blame them, but Nikon should have engineering look at the thin glass on their big screen.
